page.title: 07TESCO'S BRENT PARK
page.content: {Tesco's at Brent Park,}on the North Circular Road, is London's largest hypermarket yet took only one year to build, opening in June 1985. The store employs almost 1000 staff.It boasts 47 check-outs including three for the disabled.There are large, separate food departments selling{Kosher, {Vegetarian,West Indian and Asian food. Within the complex there is a bank which opens full store hours,a pharmacy, a bakery, a coffee shop,a demonstration kitchen and a petrol station. Heating bills are almost halved due to the electronic revolving doors in the entrance.The compressed air and duct system,once considered obsolete, is used for the transfer of cash.
